work.name: Institut de Recherche en Informatique de Toulouse (IRIT, CNRS)
highlights: Developed fusion-based 3D object detection algorithms integrating LiDAR and camera data, achieving robust performance in adverse weather conditions.

Synthesized over 7k samples (LiDAR & images) within the MultiFogKITTI dataset by augmenting the existing KITTI dataset with synthetic fog conditions; this initiative addressed data imbalances and enhanced model accuracy for 3D object detection in adverse weather scenarios.
Published and presented research findings at international conferences, journals.

work.name: VinAI
highlights: Designed LiDAR-based 3D object detection models, achieving top-tier performance in the Waymo OD Challenge.
Curated and utilized our own in-house large-scale VinScenes dataset and deployment on embedded platforms.

work.name: Laboratoire de Vision et d'Apprentissage pour l'analyse de scène (LVA, CEA-List)
highlights: Implemented and optimized YOLOv3 object detection model using PyTorch and TensorRT for high-performance Nvidia embedded platforms, doubling inference speed while keeping almost the same performance.
Developed a robust object detection and recognition pipeline tailored for large-scale datasets, incorporating advanced depth-sensing sensor to enhance accuracy and reliability.

work.name: Laboratoire Mathématiques, Image et Applications (MIA)
highlights: Reimplemented state-of-the-art 2D object detection models in TensorFlow (maiminh1996/YOLOv3-tensorflow (300 stars)) and fine-tuned them on custom boat datasets.
Deployed the model for edge devices, Raspberry Pi 3 and TurtleBot 3.
